DOC.brief_summary: 1 . Does primary stenting low 12-month restenosis rate PTA alone treatment atherosclerotic lesion popliteal artery ? - Alternative hypothesis : `` Primary stenting Edwards LifeStent associate low restenosis rate PTA alone patient atherosclerotic lesion popliteal artery 12 month '' - Null hypothesis : `` Primary stenting Edwards LifeStent associate low 12-month restenosis rate PTA alone patient atherosclerotic lesion popliteal artery '' '' 2 . Does comparison two intervention group ( PTA alone , stenting ) disclose difference term secondary endpoint ? 3 . How intervention method compare term safety/incidence adverse effect ? 4 . What long-term clinical implication two treatment method ?
DOC.brief_title: Endovascular Treatment Popliteal Artery - Balloon Angioplasty Versus Primary Stenting
DOC.criteria: The patient least 21 year old The patient legal representative provide write informed consent The patient agree comply protocolmandated followup visit test regime The patient lifestylelimiting claudication critical limb ischemia define : Fontaine stage IIaIV/ Rutherford 15 category The target lesion locate within popliteal artery angiographic evidence stenosis > 70 % occlusion ( visual estimate ) At least one vessel runoff foot The patient relevant inflow outflow stenosis ( > 50 % ) , however need iliac femoral intervention may do study procedure . The patient currently participate drug another device study . The popliteal artery target lesion previously subintimal recanalized The patient history bleeding diatheses coagulopathy Female patient pregnant The patient contraindication ( include allergic reaction ) platelet aggregation inhibitor heparin The patient unable conform study protocol followup procedures visit . The patient life expectancy < 24 month The patient concomitant renal failure require dialysis The patient contraindication ( include allergic reaction ) know sensitivity contrast medium The duplex ultrasound/angiography target lesion must NOT meet follow criterion : The popliteal artery target lesion stenosis/occlusion also continuously locate within superficial femoral artery and/or tibiofibular tract The popliteal artery target lesion restenotic The popliteal artery subintimal recanalized
